item.title: Troubleshooting Kubeform Installation
item.description: Installing in GKE Cluster If you are installing Kubeform on a GKE cluster, you will need cluster admin permissions to install Kubeform operator. Run the following command to grant admin permision to the cluster. $ kubectl create clusterrolebinding "cluster-admin-$(whoami)" \ --clusterrole=cluster-admin \ --user="$(gcloud config get-value core/account)" In addition, if your GKE cluster is a private cluster, you will need to either add an additional firewall rule that allows master nodes access port 8443/tcp on worker nodes, or change the existing rule that allows access to ports 443/tcp and 10250/tcp to also allow access to port 8443/tcp.
